title: How to identify known encryption algorithm?
content:
I reverse an .exe file with IDA.

I see a function that appears to be encrypting something by generating some random numbers.

It there any tool to identify if it is a known encryption algorithm?

comments.text: Not entirely related but you might find this question useful
I tool that can do this is peid. It searches for common magic values used in algorithms.

answers_data.content:
Signsrch is a somewhat old tool that searches for signatures and magic values for different encryption and hash algorithms. I had a collection of other similar tools in the past, so I believe you can find other related tools by googling for a while.

There's a IDA plugin re-implementation of the same plugin here, you may wanna use it instead.

comments.text: Thank you, I not understand how to install the ida plugin? Copy the plug-in and signsrch.xml file to your IDA Pro "plugins" directory. witch file do I need to copt? I saw there source file.
